page.title: 13Shaper of Nuneaton
page.content: In 1857 a poor Cornishman,{Reginald {Stanley,}went to America. 10 years later, after growing and selling potatoes, involvement in Red Indian wars, and gold hunting in Montana, he returned to Nuneaton a rich man and bought his brother-in-law's business in Stockingford. Soon he owned 7 brickyards, 2 coalmines, an engineering firm at the bottom of {Tuttle Hill}and a toolmakers. Through his{ornamental tiles and bricks,}and his personality, he affected the shape and architecture of Nuneaton. A prominent Methodist and teetotaller, he became known as the{'Great Man'}of the town. Today, the mines and works have disappeared, but the large brickworks on{Croft Road}still bear his name and continue to produce those materials he became famous for.
